title: Cozy Creamy Low Carb Chicken Casserole for Comforting Dinners
promptIMG: Food photography: Creamy Low Carb Chicken Casserole, appetizing presentation, natural lighting, kitchen setting, documentary style, realistic colors --ar 4:3 --quality 2
description: This creamy low carb chicken casserole is a comforting dish perfect for busy weeknights. With tender chicken and broccoli, it's a satisfying meal that won't weigh you down!
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese and chicken broth until smooth.
Stir in the garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Add the shredded chicken and steamed broccoli to the mixture, folding gently to combine.
Transfer the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish and top with shredded cheddar cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the cheese is bubbly and golden.
Let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
tips: For a bit of extra flavor, try adding some cooked bacon bits on top before baking. If you're in a pinch, rotisserie chicken works great here! Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days.

structured_content.content: There's something so comforting about a warm casserole, and this creamy low carb chicken casserole is no exception. I love making it for busy weeknights when I want something hearty but don't want to spend hours in the kitchen. Plus, it's packed with protein and veggies, making it a guilt-free indulgence!

This recipe is all about simplicity and flavor. You’ll need cooked chicken, which can be shredded from a rotisserie or leftover from another meal. The cream cheese is what makes this casserole creamy and rich, while broccoli adds a nice crunch. If you’re not a fan of broccoli, feel free to swap it out for cauliflower!
Making this casserole is super easy! Just mix your ingredients together, pop it in the oven, and let the magic happen. It’s a great dish to prepare ahead of time and bake when you’re ready to eat.

upload.context: Creamy Low Carb Chicken Casserole on a rustic wooden table

structured_content.content: One thing I love - This casserole is perfect for serving alongside a fresh green salad or some roasted vegetables. You can also customize it by adding your favorite spices or even a sprinkle of crushed red pepper for a little heat!
